content.description: Decent warm up with a tough mantle
content.location: Sit start on the far right sight of the Grapes boulder. Traverse up and left to a challenging topout.

content.description: The classic on this smaller boulder. Sit start on opposing sidepulls and climb straight up on bullet rock.
content.location: 20 feet to the south of the Brush Monkey boulder. NW Facing.

content.description: Tough first move to cool face moves on crimps/slots with delicate feet and a juggy finish.
content.location: Around the corner of the arête right next to the warm-up lay back - shared finish.

content.description: Stand start on the right side of the boulder, make balancey moves on mostly positive holds. Finishes with a technical crux to the juggy lip.
content.location: Right side of the brush monkey boulder on top of a rock ledge.

content.description: Pull on with good holds and feet - follow the crack up and right to good holds at the top.
content.location: Around the left side of the boulder, obvious crack feature.

content.description: Start on the arete as for Brush Monkey, at the 10 foot mark bust right into a series of rails that leads you over a pretty bad landing. Nice rest after the crux and finish straight up and slightly right over a better landing, finishing the same as Hold my Purse.
content.location: Read the overview of the area, this problem starts on the prominent arete and busts right.

content.description: Sit start on decent holds, stab to a jug and weasel your way up the nice arete. Somewhat off the deck with a great landing. More classic if you stand start.
content.location: Prominent Arete of the Brush Monkey boulder, hard to miss.

content.description: Cool moves on small crimps and slopers finishing with a desperate toss to the lip.
content.location: Sit start on obvious compression crimps, same as Tiny Hands. Traverse left to an apparent crux sequence. A more direct start may be possible but substantially more difficult.

content.description: A few quality boulders among the brush, great views with quality stone make this area a great experience. Broad range of difficulties here makes it enjoyable for most. It seems likely that folks climbed here in the past. Let me know if anyone has information on the boulders listed and i'm happy to change names or put in FA information.
